column2: Christy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: throughout my life i have had a lot of stomach problems. i've recently had a colonoscopy, endoscopy, ct scans of my pelvis and abdomon, along with a lot of blood work etc..my doctor put me on pentasa 4 days ago. my biggest inconvenience is the fact that i cannot swallow large pills, which pentasa is. my doctor told me i could open the pill up and put it on a spoon with apple sauce, pudding, ice cream and what have you. i take 2 capsules 4 times a day. i  know the medication doesn't absorb into your blood and just sits in your colon. this morning i noticed some of the beads from inside the capsule in my stool. is this supposed to be happening? i feel like i would have noticed this on day 1? i need to call my doctor when he returns to his office, but needed some peace of mind until then & was curious if anyone else is on the same boat as me.

column2: cyrtanz, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Been on Pentasa for  12 years. 2x500mgm tabs am and pm to control uc.  Have had no relapses over that time.  Excellent, rather benign drug - have not experienced any side effects.

column2: Sally, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Have been taking 750 mg three times a day for the last 8 years. Works quite well. As the years go by, there are fewer flare-ups due to the learning curve! The only difficulty I have had with Pentasa is remembering to take it after lunch at work.

column2: 65-74 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: 55-y/o female with Ulcerative colitis for 30 years, currently with mild symptoms of flare-up and mild inflammation evident on colonoscopy; started Pentasa 500mg, 2 pills 4x/day.  After 1st dose, had some diarrhea within 2 hours. After second dose, started having increasing diarrhea and watery stools.  After third dose, abdominal pain, nausea, light-headedness, back pain (in the area of kidneys) along with increased frequency of watery stools. After 4th dose, couldn't leave the house. Stopped med. It took two days for diarrhea and nausea to end.  Spent another 3 days off med and tried again, this time 1 pill 3x/day.  Same thing happened.  I obviously cannot tolerate this drug.  Have started Sulfasalazine and will see how that goes.

column2: BLJEEPER, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: THIS MEDACATION REALLY WORKED FOR ME I TOOK IT FOR ABOUT A MONTH STARTED FEELING BETTER AND STOPED TAKING IT AND MY CONDITION CAME BACK SO IF YOUR TAKING IT AND BEGAIN TO FEEL BETTER DON'T STOP I WAS WARNED BY MY DR. NOT TO STOP WHEN I FEEL BETTER BUT I DIDN'T LISTEN NOW I'M BACK ON IT AGAIN AND FEEL MUCH BETTER

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: has not helped my Crohn's but gave me OsteoArthritis,Osteopenia,and Osteoperosis from the amount of Steroids in this medication.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had a bowel obstruction in 2005, with small bowel resection. Pentasa put me in remission, lost my job/insurance Feb 09, landed in the hospital Oct 09 with partial obstuction. Waiting for help from the drug manufacturer in Canada as Pentasa is the only thing between me and another surgery.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed Crohn's 04/20/09.It seems starting Pentasa can be hard. Feeling lite headed at times. After five months of use, had chest pain and went to ER. Follow up with Cardiac DR, now on heart medicine for one year. Was told I had an irregular heart beat. Any correlation with drug? Personally, I don't know. Cardiac DR said NO. Back at two months of use, I took myself off of Pentasa for one month, (I was in denial of having Crohn's), I went back to having diarhea and abdominal pain. Got myself back on Pentasa. Ninety percent pain free. Bowl movements are solid and easy to have as long as you drink plenty of water.I take two capsules, 500 mg each, for times daily. I work Grave yard and want to sleep. It's hard to wake up to take the medication and then wake up later AGAIN to go use restroom due to full bladder.  Botom line, as one person said it, the inconvience of taking the medicine is nothing as compared to the extreme pain if you don't take it.

column2: susan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have constipation with my colitis.It seems to make it worse.I haven;t heard of anyone else having constipation with colitis,maybe it just dont work for me.

column2: scott, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: i was diagnosed in 1990, have had several resections and tried many drugs. currently for the last ten years i have taken pentasa. 3000 mg/daily. i take 1500 mg in am and 1500 in pm. also take 6MP (mercapurine) 50 mg daily. i have been symptom free and bowel movements have dropped to 1-2 times a day from 6 to 10, mainly depends on what i eat.

I was diagnosed with Crohns earlier this year and was placed on pentasa 2 tablets 4x a day to see if this would control my symptoms and it has worked great! i have very few flare ups and its working so well that soon i will be able to lower the dosage. Few headaches during the beginning of taking it but now I have no side effects.

column2: shawnecarter, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed w/ ulcertive colitis in '84, woohoo!! upgraded to crohn's in 2000. Long story . . . 4 tabs;4x each day, plus 2 purinethal, lab tests each month to see if I was destroying my liver. Quit taking meds altogether. Extremely bad news. Tried something new. Garden of life primal defense, works unbelievably well. Started eating 5 - 8 times a day smaller portions, cleaner foods, following a low impact carb style diet, working out more. Now, no more purinethal, 1x1 pentasa each day, 1 "dirt pill" each day. have the symptoms so well under control I was able to go to Iraq for a year and use my professional knowledge to support coalition forces.
